articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The death toll in weekend attacks in the central Nigerian state of Plateau has risen to 113, a local official said on Monday, in a region where clashes between herders and farmers are common.
articles.title: At least 113 killed in attacks in central Nigeria, local official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkey said on Monday its air force "neutralised" 26 Kurdish militants in strikes in Syria and northern Iraq in response to the killing of soldiers at the weekend, while authorities also detained dozens of pro-Kurdish opposition activists.
articles.title: Turkey retaliates at home, abroad after troops killed in Iraq

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli air strike outside the Syrian capital Damascus on Monday killed a senior adviser in Iran's Revolutionary Guards, three security sources and Iran's state media said.
articles.title: Israeli air strike in Syria kills senior Iranian Revolutionary Guards member

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's government has proposed to parliament terminating a free trade agreement with Belarus, which supports Russia's invasion of Ukraine that began in February 2022, cabinet minister Taras Melnychuk said on Monday.
articles.title: Ukraine seeks to terminate free trade deal with Belarus

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Denmark's Maersk (MAERSKb.CO) is preparing to resume shipping operations in the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden, the company said on Sunday, citing the deployment of a U.S.-led military operation designed to ensure the safety of commerce in the area.
articles.title: Shipping giant Maersk prepares to resume operations in Red Sea

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Bassam Masoud, Emily Rose
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed to keep up the fight against Hamas militants, but a United Nations humanitarian team leader said Palestinian civilians in Gaza who honor Israeli evacuation orders cannot be guaranteed they will be safe.
articles.title: Netanyahu vows no let-up in war but UN worker says Gazans have no place to go

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Andrius Sytas
articles.description: Jailed Russian opposition politician Alexei Navalny has been tracked down to a penal colony north of the Arctic Circle, his spokeswoman said on Monday, after supporters lost touch with him for more than two weeks.
articles.title: Russia's Navalny tracked down to 'Polar Wolf' prison in the Arctic

articles.author: Anirban Sen, Anousha Sakoui
articles.description: Mergers and acquisitions (M&A) activity fell to its lowest level in ten years globally in 2023, as high interest rates and an economic slowdown weighed on companies' dealmaking confidence, but bankers and lawyers expect a pick-up as conditions improve.
articles.title: Dealmakers see rebound after global M&A volumes hit decade-low

articles.author: Brendan Pierson
articles.description: Bayer has won a trial in a lawsuit brought by a California man who said he developed cancer from exposure to its Roundup weedkiller, ending what had been a five-trial losing streak for the company in trials over similar claims.
articles.title: Bayer wins latest Roundup cancer trial, ending losing streak

articles.author: John Kruzel
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Friday declined to immediately decide former President Donald Trump's claim that he cannot be prosecuted for trying to overturn his 2020 election defeat, allowing a lower court to continue reviewing the issue.
articles.title: Supreme Court rejects prosecutor's request, will not rule on Trump immunity yet
